result.title: 1 Top High-Yield Dividend Stock I'd Buy Without Hesitation in December
result.text: A string of problems has dragged Clorox's stock down. The company is finally showing signs of a rebound, led by an impressive return on invested capital.

result.title: Will Clorox's Pricing Power Hold as Consumer Elasticity Tightens?
result.text: CLX tests its pricing power as consumers trade down, promotions rise, and margins stay under pressure in a tightening demand environment.

result.title: My 3 Favorite Dividend Stocks to Buy Right Now
result.text: Consumer staples companies sell products that are purchased regularly, in both good and bad economies. Consumer staples companies tend to be reliable dividend payers.

result.title: The Smartest Dividend Stocks to Buy With $1,000 Right Now
result.text: Chevron is an integrated energy company with an impressive yield and an impressive dividend history. Bristol Myers has a high yield, but the drugmaker is out of favor.

result.title: Clorox's Brand Investments Are Up: Will They Translate to Growth?
result.text: CLX leans on heavier brand investment and new product launches to rebuild momentum as ERP-related disruptions weigh on near-term sales.

result.title: Clorox: Headwinds Linger, But Its Near 5% Yield Makes It Hard To Ignore
result.text: Clorox (CLX) faces near-term headwinds, but its 4.6% dividend yield and depressed valuation offer long-term appeal. CLX's FY26 outlook is weak, with sales expected to decline 610% and EPS down 21%, but management anticipates improvement in the back half. The digital transformation and product innovation are expected to unlock value, though benefits may take 12 years to materialize.

result.title: Clorox: A Dividend Champion Facing Headwinds, But Still A Buy
result.text: Clorox is a market leader in consumer products with a 48-year dividend growth streak and a nearly 5% yield, now trading at a decade-high yield. Despite recent revenue and EPS declines from ERP transition, cyberattack, and inflation, CLX is executing its IGNITE plan to drive 35% sales growth and higher margins. Dividend safety metrics remain acceptable, with a forward payout ratio of 73% and manageable leverage, supporting continued low single-digit dividend growth.

result.title: THE COLLAB WE'VE ALL BEEN WAITING FOR: GLAD DROPS TRASH-FILLED MUSICAL NUMBER STARRING OSCAR THE GROUCH
result.text: Glad launches all-new "Don't Get Mad. Get Glad." campaign, featuring a remix of Oscar's hit song "I Love Trash".

result.title: My 3 Favorite Stocks to Buy Right Now
result.text: Amazon is a compelling value for all the growth it still has ahead. Clorox is ready to wake up after a tough few years.

result.title: Best Dividend Aristocrats For December 2025
result.text: The ProShares S&P 500 Dividend Aristocrats ETF (NOBL) has underperformed the SPDR S&P 500 ETF (SPY) year-to-date, but November shows a reversal. Several Dividend Aristocrats, including CAH, CAT, CHRW, and ALB, have posted double-digit gains in 2025, while others lag behind. Dividend growth among Aristocrats averages 5.46% for 2025, with most constituents announcing increases, though growth is slightly below 2024 levels.

result.title: Clorox Q1: There Are Concerns Beyond Transitory ERP Weakness
result.text: The Clorox Company reported very weak fiscal Q1 results. The company's ERP-related disruption caused most of the quarter's weakness. CLX's underlying consumption has also been weak. A weak consumer has caused below-usual category growth and competitive pressure from lower-cost substitutes. The quarter causes more cautious growth estimates for Clorox as the company struggles to grow market share and maintain pricing.

result.title: Has Clorox Become A Value Stock?
result.text: Clorox (CLX) has seen a meaningful decline in its share price over the past year, pressured by post-pandemic normalization, rising input costs, and the aftereffects of the cyberattack that disrupted operations. Once viewed as a defensive growth name, the stock's premium valuation has faded as investor sentiment cooled.
